educations.schoolName: University of Maine School of Law

headline: Deputy Chief Counsel at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

defaultPosition.description:
- Supervise and manage team of attorneys and support staff.
- Implement agency initiatives.
- Oversee all aspects of immigration litigation, including matters involving national security, human rights abuses, aggravated felonies, worksite enforcement investigations, and relief from removal.
- Supervise attorneys in other areas including federal employment and customs law, procedure, and policy.
- 2016 DHS Office of General Counsel Award for Excellence.
defaultPosition.title: Deputy Chief Counsel

positions.description:
- Supervise and manage team of attorneys and support staff.
- Implement agency initiatives.
- Oversee all aspects of immigration litigation, including matters involving national security, human rights abuses, aggravated felonies, worksite enforcement investigations, and relief from removal.
- Supervise attorneys in other areas including federal employment and customs law, procedure, and policy.
- 2016 DHS Office of General Counsel Award for Excellence.
positions.title: Deputy Chief Counsel

positions.description:
- Senior immigration litigator.
- Responsible for complex cases involving threats to national security and human rights abusers.
- Litigated high-profile cases of interest to the agency as well as media and other non-governmental entities.
- Handled other complex matters including worksite enforcement and I-9 compliance.
positions.title: Senior Attorney

positions.description:
- Trial attorney responsible for all aspects of federal immigration prosecutions.
- Experience litigating matters in Miami, FL, Baltimore, MD, and Charlotte, NC.
positions.title: Assistant Chief Counsel
